channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Americans Overwhelmingly Support Voter ID Laws Dems Want To Squash
item.description: The popular election integrity measures are restoring trust in elections. Gov. Gavin Newsom and California Dems are working to stop them.

item.title: China and Europe target Big Tech in scramble to fight back against Trump’s tariff broadside
item.description: Chinese antitrust authorities look into Google and Apple, as the EU threatens seismic moves if the U.S. uses tariffs to twist its arm.

item.title: GOP-led Senate confirming president's nominees at faster pace than Biden admin, first Trump term
item.description: President Donald Trump's nominees for his positions in his second term are shaping up quicker than his first term and former President Joe Biden's.

item.title: New Jersey Unions Demand State Hire Teachers Who Struggle To Read Or Write
item.description: Unions are not interested in representing excellent teachers or providing children with superior educational experiences.

item.title: Netanyahu hails Trump, calls him 'greatest friend' of Israel in White House
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu heaped praise on President Trump at a press conference Tuesday, saying he's done more for the Jewish state t...

item.title: Welcome News from Panama
item.description: Trump is cutting deals — from Central America to Canada.

item.title: Governor Pritzker’s Partisan Lawfare Against President Trump’s J6 Pardons
item.description: He is taking steps to block J6 defendants from state employment.

item.title: Just Like Prostitution, There’s No First Amendment Right To Pornography
item.description: The First Amendment doesn't protect sexual abuse images. Pornography is not speech. It is prostitution and must be abolished.

item.title: Defunding USAID Isn’t About Reducing The Deficit, It’s About Shutting Down Left-Wing Propaganda
item.description: USAID isn’t just a ridiculous scam on U.S. taxpayers, it funds leftist causes that erode western civilization and destroy traditional values.

item.title: For America’s Military, Personnel Is Victory
item.description: Motivated and experienced personnel will be our asymmetric advantage in a potential future conflict with a near-peer adversary.

item.title: Trump budget bill could see 'roughly' $1 trillion in baseline spending cuts, top Republican says
item.description: House Republican leaders are working to come to an agreement with fiscal hawks about what spending cuts to seek in legislation advancing Trump's agend...

item.title: Trump’s Win in Panama
item.description: Trump spoke loudly and swung a big stick in Panama’s direction, and it produced instantaneous results.

item.title: For Investment Leaders: Why You Should Learn to Love Losing
item.description: Sébastien Page, CFA, shares the story of a grueling handball match that reshaped a competitor’s mindset and reveals how investment leaders can apply t...

item.title: Google is spending massively on AI—but an analyst says it’s making the ‘right moves at the right time’
item.description: Staying competitive in the AI arms race is pricey.

item.title: Volatility Laundering: Public Pension Funds and the Impact of NAV Adjustments
item.description: Are public pension funds truly delivering the returns they claim?

item.title: Venezuelan gang members become first migrants shipped to Guantanamo Bay
item.description: Homeland Security shipped its first planeload of illegal immigrants from the U.S. to Guantanamo Bay, with officials saying the plane carried members o...

item.title: Is the Democrats’ Problem That They’re Not Obnoxious Enough?
item.description: They don’t need self-indulgent lectures on how to be more off-putting. They’ve already got the act down pat.

item.title: Beyond the Hype: Do Hedge Funds Deliver Value?
item.description: Skill and alpha are scarce and difficult to obtain in the hedge fund market.

item.title: USAID direct-hire staffers put on leave worldwide
item.description: The Trump administration is placing U.S. Agency for International Development direct-hire staffers around the world on leave, except those deemed esse...

item.title: Book Review: The Making of Modern Corporate Finance
item.description: Donald Chew delivers a love letter to unfettered capitalism and the financial system that oils the gears of commerce.

item.title: 'Squad' Dem Ayanna Pressley trashes Elon Musk, calling him a 'Nazi nepo baby'
item.description: Rep. Ayanna Pressley trashed business tycoon Elon Musk, calling him a "Nazi nepo baby," and a "godless, lawless billionaire."

item.title: Meet the high school athletes making up to $2,000 a post from brand deals with Adidas and Red Bull
item.description: Teenage athletes with dedicated social media followings are becoming the next generation of brand ambassadors, and they can make millions.

item.title: What’s the Winning Ingredient in M&A? The Answer Lies in Due Diligence
item.description: The days of due diligence as a box-checking exercise are over.

item.title: As growth slows, CFO says Novo Nordisk is prepping for the next generation of weight loss drugs
item.description: Novo Nordisk's Karsten Munk Knudsen is targeting 800 million obese people globally.

item.title: Senate confirms Pam Bondi as attorney general
item.description: The Senate voted 54-46 on Tuesday, largely along party lines, to confirm Pam Bondi as Attorney General of the Department of Justice.

item.title: Exclusive: Little Otter, AI-powered family mental health startup, raises $9.5 million in funding
item.description: The San Francisco-based startup is led by a mother-daughter cofounder team.

item.title: Oklahoma Republicans Are Helping Green Energy Cronies Scam Taxpayers Out Of Billions
item.description: Funding 'green energy' companies with tax dollars may pick a few winners, but taxpayers lose, as with startup Canoo in Oklahoma.
